intro: Pedicularis gruina subsp. gruina, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
